roleset.name: view
roleset.note: SEE-V NOTES: Member of Vncls characterize-29.2-1, consider-29.9-1-1, see-30.1-1 (from see.01-v)

example.name: see-v: see an S
example.text: John saw that the President collapsed.

example.name: see-v: NP and attribute as PP
example.text: John saw the President as a fool.

example.name: sight-v: found
example.text: [No major oil concentrations]-1 have been sighted *-1 recently more than 6 miles northwest of the source of the vessel .
example.arg: more than 6 miles northwest of the source of the vessel

example.name: sight-n: both args
example.text: The climax is his visit to the dead man's house and his sight of the body.

example.name: sight-n: just arg1
example.text: The sight of professionals in suits and ties rushing to class at dusk contrasts greatly from the typical jeans and casual attire of fresh - faced undergrads .
example.arg: of professionals in suits and ties rushing to class at dusk

roleset.name: verb of motion: accompany
roleset.note: SEE-V NOTES: Arg2 could also be "out" or some other non-PP. (from see.02-v)

example.name: see-v: a polite young man
example.text: John saw the President to his car.

roleset.name: discourse function
roleset.note: SEE-V NOTES: I don't know if this even occurs. (from see.03-v)

example.name: see-v: you see
example.text: After Mary killed John, you see, she had to win the Nobel Prize.

roleset.name: ensure
roleset.note: SEE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'see' based on revamping Chris' old frames file. (from see.04-v predicate notes)

example.name: see to it
example.text: They should see to it that their kids don't play truant; they should make certain that the children spend enough time doing homework; they should scrutinize the report card.
example.arg: that their kids don't play truant

roleset.name: date casually
roleset.note: SEE-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. No VNcls. (from see.05-v)

example.name: both args
example.text: I was n't in a relationship with this guy but we 've been seeing each other .
